content.description: You are asked to identify pitch patterns. After a question is announced, you will have ten seconds to read the relevant choices. It is important that you read the choices carefully before the example is played. Each example will be played twice, with a brief pause between playings.
content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: The figure presents a staff with a treble clef. There is no key signature. The time signature is of two four time. There are three measures. The rhythm in measure one is: quarter and qaurter note. The pitches are: D 4 and G 4. The rhythm in measure two is: eighth note, eighth note and quarter note. The pitches are: A 4, G 4 and F 4. The rhythm in measure three is: Half note and the pitch is G 4.

The pitches are: D4 and G4. The rhythm in measure two is: eighth note, eighth note and quarter note. The pitches are: A 4, G 4 and F sharp 4. The rhythm in measure three is: Half note and the pitch is G 4.

content.answer: The figure presents a staff with a treble clef. There is no key signature. The time signature is of two four time. There are three measures. unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
